required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Choledocolithiasis by Laparoscopic Exploration
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Choledocolithiasis by Laparoscopic Exploration of The Bile Tract After Failed Endoscopic Cholangiopancreatography

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Seguridad y Servicios Sociales de los Trabajadores del Estado

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Seguridad y Servicios Sociales de los Trabajadores del Estado

brief_summary.textblock: There are three treatment options for choledocholithiasis: endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) followed by laparoscopic cholecystectomy; laparoscopic exploration of the main bile duct with concomitant cholecystectomy; and open cholecystectomy with exploration of the main bile duct. A retrospective, descriptive, observational study was taken of patients with a diagnosis of cholecystocholedocholithiasis that failed ERCP and who underwent laparoscopic cholecystectomy with exploration of the bile duct.

detailed_description.textblock: this study was revision of clinical files.

primary_outcome.description: TREATMENT OF CHOLEDOCOLITHIASIS AFTER FAILED ENDOSCOPIC CHOLANGIOPANCREATOGRAPHY

intervention.intervention_name: none, this is an observational study
intervention.description: none, this is an observational study

study_pop.textblock: patients with a diagnosis of cholecyto-choledocholithiasis with failed ERCP and who were taken to LCDE in the General Surgery service of the General Ignacio Zaragoza

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a diagnosis of cholecyto-choledocholithiasis with failed ERCP and who were taken to LCDE in the General Surgery service
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 18 year old

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Instituto de Seguridad y Servicios Sociales de los Trabajadores del Estado
